content.title: Go-Green Three Wheelers Scheme (GBOCWWB)
content.department: Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat
content.details: The 'Go-Green Three Wheelers Scheme' is implemented by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board (GBOCWWB). Under the scheme, a one-time subsidy will be provided on the purchase of battery-operated tricycle (e-rickshaw) vehicles to registered construction disabled workers. The objective is to help construction workers who become disabled due to accidents at construction sites sustain their livelihoods.
benefits: One-time subsidy of 50% of the Ex-Showroom Price or ₹48,000/- whichever is less.
Assistance for the amount of Registration Fee and Road Tax paid for the first time of the new Three-Wheeler.
eligibility: The construction workers should be registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board.
Registered construction workers who become disabled or incapacitated due to an accident while working at a construction site.
Registered construction disabled worker should have purchased a lithium-ion battery-operated vehicle in his own name.
Registered construction disabled worker should hold a tri-cycle license to operate a tri-cycle.
The benefit of this scheme will be available once per registered construction disabled worker.
content.application_process: To avail of the benefits under the scheme, applicants need to visit the nearest district office of the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board, collect the application form, fill in all details, attach required documents, and submit the application form to the concerned official.
documents_required: RTO of the registered construction worker
Certificate of incapacity from the Certifying Civil Surgeon

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective of the scheme is to provide financial support to registered construction workers who become disabled or incapacitated due to accidents at construction sites.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligibility criteria include registration with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board, being a registered construction worker who became disabled due to a construction site accident, owning a lithium-ion battery-operated vehicle, holding a tri-cycle license, and availing the scheme once per registered construction disabled worker.

faqs.question: What are the benefits offered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible individuals can receive a one-time subsidy of 50% of the ex-showroom price or up to ₹48,000, whichever is less, for purchasing an e-rickshaw.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must visit the nearest district office of Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board, collect the application form, fill in all required details, attach necessary documents, and submit them to the concerned official.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy be availed multiple times?
faqs.answer: No, the benefit of this scheme is available only once per registered construction disabled worker.

faqs.question: What type of vehicles are covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers battery-operated tricycle (e-rickshaw) vehicles powered by lithium-ion batteries.
